page.title: 15Telscombe Youth Hostel
page.content: The Youth Hostel is housed in a 200 year old building and is said to have its own ghost - a shepherd and his dog. The Hostel was opened in 1979 and has space for 16 males and 12 females with room for camping. It has few rules (no pets or alcohol. At 13 you may stay unaccompanied by an adult. 5 is the youngest age that one may stay at any hostel. There is a line of hostels along the Southdowns Way. Telscombe is between Patcham (10 miles away) and Alfreston (12 miles away) and is open 5pm - 11pm and 7am - 10am during the summer. Residents are expected to cook their own meals and provide a bed-sheet. Visitors at the hostel have come from ll over the world, some to walk on the downs, some heading for pop festivals! The ages have been varied including a 97 year old ex sailor.
